articles.title: Pronounce Polish Letters: Åš Ä† Å¹ Å» Å
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Learning Polish pronunciation together as a couple can be both challenging and fun! The five letters that give English speakers the most trouble are **Åš**, **Ä†**, **Å¹**, **Å»**, and **Å**. Master these sounds, and you'll unlock proper Polish pronunciation that will impress native speakers.

<PhraseOfDay
  polish="Ä†wiczenie czyni mistrza"
  english="Practice makes perfect"
  pronunciation="chvee-CHE-nyeh CHEE-nee MEES-tsha"
  context="The perfect motto for learning these tricky Polish sounds together!"
/>

## The Polish Alphabet Basics

Polish uses the Latin alphabet with 32 letters, including 9 with diacritical marks (accent marks). These special letters represent unique sounds that don't exist in English, which is why they're so important to master.

<CultureTip title="Why These Letters Matter">
Mispronouncing these letters can completely change word meanings! For example, **byÄ‡** (to be) versus **biÄ‡** (to hit) - one wrong sound and you've gone from philosophy to violence!
</CultureTip>

## Åš - The Soft "Sh" Sound

The letter **Åš** (called **eÅ›** in Polish) makes a soft "sh" sound, similar to English "she" but softer and more delicate.

<VocabCard
  polish="Åšnieg"
  english="Snow"
  pronunciation="shnyeg"
  example="Pada Å›nieg! (It's snowing!)"
/>

### Practice Words with Åš:

| Polish Word | English | Pronunciation | Tip |
|---|---|---|---|
| **miÅ‚oÅ›Ä‡** | love | MEE-woshch | The most romantic word to practice! |
| **Å›miech** | laughter | shmyeh | Perfect for couples learning together |
| **Å›niadanie** | breakfast | shnya-DA-nyeh | Say it every morning |
| **Å›wiat** | world | shvyat | "My whole world" = **mÃ³j caÅ‚y Å›wiat** |

> **Pronunciation tip:** Place your tongue closer to the roof of your mouth than for English "sh". It should sound more refined and gentle.

## Ä† - The Soft "Ch" Sound

**Ä†** (called **cie**) is like a soft "ch" sound, similar to the "ch" in "cheap" but much softer and more forward in the mouth.

<VocabCard
  polish="Ä†wiczenie"
  english="Exercise/Practice"
  pronunciation="chvee-CHE-nyeh"
  example="RÃ³bmy Ä‡wiczenie razem! (Let's practice together!)"
/>

### Common Words with Ä†:

- **niÄ‡** (thread) - pronounced "neech"
- **piÄ™Ä‡** (five) - pronounced "pyench"
- **Ä‡ma** (moth) - pronounced "chma"
- **Ä‡wierÄ‡** (quarter) - pronounced "chvyerch"

**Memory trick:** Think of "cute" but make the "t" much softer - almost like whispering.

## Å¹ - The Soft "Z" Sound

The letter **Å¹** (called **ziet**) is a soft "z" sound, like a gentle buzzing. It's the soft counterpart to the regular **z**.

<VocabCard
  polish="Å¹rebiÄ™"
  english="Foal (baby horse)"
  pronunciation="ZHRE-byeh"
  example="Jakie sÅ‚odkie ÅºrebiÄ™! (What a sweet foal!)"
/>

### Practice with Å¹:

- **ÅºrÃ³dÅ‚o** (source, spring) - "ZHRO-dwo"
- **ÅºdÅºbÅ‚o** (blade of grass) - "ZHDZH-bwo"
- **koÅºlÄ™** (baby goat) - "KOZH-leh"

## Å» - The Hard "Zh" Sound

**Å»** (called **Å¼et**) makes a "zh" sound like the "s" in "pleasure" or "vision". It's harder and more prominent than **Å¹**.

<VocabCard
  polish="Å»ona"
  english="Wife"
  pronunciation="ZHO-na"
  example="Moja Å¼ona jest piÄ™kna (My wife is beautiful)"
/>

### Essential Å» Words:

| Polish | English | Pronunciation | Usage |
|---|---|---|---|
| **juÅ¼** | already | zhush | "JuÅ¼ ciÄ™ kocham" (I already love you) |
| **moÅ¼e** | maybe | MO-zheh | "MoÅ¼e pÃ³jdziemy razem?" (Maybe we'll go together?) |
| **Å¼ycie** | life | ZHY-cheh | "JesteÅ› moim Å¼yciem" (You are my life) |
| **Å¼art** | joke | zhart | Perfect for playful couples! |

<CultureTip title="Å¹ vs Å» Confusion">
Many Polish learners confuse these sounds. **Å¹** is softer and more delicate, while **Å»** is harder and more pronounced. Practice saying **ÅºrebiÄ™** (foal) versus **Å¼aba** (frog) to hear the difference!
</CultureTip>

## Å - The "W" Sound

The letter **Å** (called **eÅ‚**) is pronounced like the English "w" in "water". This often surprises English speakers who expect it to sound like "L".

<VocabCard
  polish="ÅÃ³Å¼ko"
  english="Bed"
  pronunciation="WOOZH-ko"
  example="Nasze Å‚Ã³Å¼ko jest wygodne (Our bed is comfortable)"
/>

### Master These Å Words:

- **Å‚awka** (bench) - "WAV-ka"
- **Å‚yÅ¼ka** (spoon) - "WYSH-ka"
- **Å‚aska** (grace, favor) - "WAS-ka"
- **gÅ‚owa** (head) - "gwo-VA"
- **sÅ‚aw** (I was - past tense of "to be") - "waw"

> **Historical note:** The **Å** used to be pronounced like a hard "L" centuries ago, but evolved to the "w" sound in modern Polish.

## Practice Together: Common Phrases

Here are romantic phrases that use these tricky letters - perfect for couples to practice:

1. **"ÅšniÅ‚em o tobie"** (I dreamed about you) - "SHNEE-wem o TO-byeh"
2. **"CaÅ‚ujÄ™ ciÄ™"** (I kiss you) - "tsa-WU-yeh cheh"
3. **"Å»ycie bez ciebie to Å¼art"** (Life without you is a joke) - "ZHY-cheh bez CHE-byeh to zhart"
4. **"ÅÃ³Å¼ko bez ciebie jest puste"** (The bed without you is empty) - "WOOZH-ko bez CHE-byeh yest PUS-teh"

## Memory Techniques for Couples

### The "Couple's Method":
- **Åš**: "**S**oft **s**weetie" - practice with **sÅ‚odki** (sweet)
- **Ä†**: "**C**ute **c**uddles" - practice with **caÅ‚owaÄ‡** (to kiss)
- **Å¹**: "**Z**entle **z**ephyr" - practice with **zima** (winter)
- **Å»**: "**Zh**ealous **zh**eart" - practice with **Å¼arty** (jokes)
- **Å**: "**L**ove **w**ith a **w**" - practice with **Å‚aska** (grace)

### Daily Practice Routine:

**Morning (5 minutes):**
- Say **"Åšniadanie"** (breakfast) together
- Practice **"Ä†wiczenie"** (exercise) before your workout
- Use **"Å»ycie"** (life) in a sentence

**Evening (5 minutes):**
- Count to five: **"jeden, dwa, trzy, cztery, piÄ™Ä‡"** (focus on **piÄ™Ä‡**)
- Say goodnight: **"ÅÃ³Å¼ko czeka"** (the bed is waiting)

## Common Mistakes to Avoid

1. **Don't** pronounce **Å** like English "L" - it's always "w"
2. **Don't** make **Åš** too harsh - it should be gentle
3. **Don't** confuse **Ä†** with English "ch" in "chair" - it's much softer
4. **Don't** skip the buzzing quality of **Å¹** and **Å»**
5. **Don't** rush - these sounds need deliberate practice

## Test Your Progress

Try reading these sentences aloud with your partner:

1. **"Åšmieje siÄ™, Ä‡wiczy i Å¼yje Å¼yciem peÅ‚nym miÅ‚oÅ›ci"** (She laughs, exercises, and lives a life full of love)
2. **"ÅÃ³Å¼ko, Å‚awka i Å‚yÅ¼ka - wszystko na Å"** (Bed, bench, and spoon - everything with Å)
3. **"MoÅ¼e ÅºrebiÄ™ zjadÅ‚o Å¼Ã³Å‚ty ÅºdÅºbÅ‚o?"** (Maybe the foal ate the yellow blade of grass?)

<CultureTip title="Regional Variations">
Some regions of Poland have slightly different pronunciations of these letters. Don't worry about regional differences when starting out - focus on standard Polish pronunciation first!
</CultureTip>

## Why These Letters Open Doors

Mastering **Åš**, **Ä†**, **Å¹**, **Å»**, and **Å** isn't just about pronunciation - it's about respect for the Polish language and culture. When Polish speakers hear you making an effort with these challenging sounds, they appreciate your dedication to learning their language properly.

Plus, these letters appear in some of the most important words in Polish:
- **miÅ‚oÅ›Ä‡** (love) - with **Åš**
- **Ä‡wiczenie** (practice) - with **Ä†**
- **Å¼ycie** (life) - with **Å»**
- **Å‚Ã³Å¼ko** (bed) - with **Å**


<CTA
  text="Ready to perfect your Polish pronunciation together?"
  buttonText="Start Learning"
/>

articles.title: 50 Phrases Romantiques Polonaises pour Faire Fondre Partenaire
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Rien n'est plus romantique que d'apprendre la langue de votre partenaire pour lui murmurer des mots doux dans sa langue maternelle. Ces phrases romantiques polonaises transformeront vos moments ensemble en souvenirs inoubliables. PrÃªt Ã  faire battre son cÅ“ur plus fort ?

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Kocham ciÄ™"
  translation="Je t'aime"
  pronunciation="KOH-hahm chyeh"
  context="La phrase la plus importante - Ã  utiliser quotidiennement avec votre partenaire"
/>

## Les Essentiels de l'Amour : 10 Phrases Que Tous Les Couples Devraient Savoir

Ces phrases fondamentales formeront la base de vos Ã©changes romantiques. Commencez par celles-ci pour crÃ©er une connexion profonde avec votre partenaire polonais.

<VocabCard
  word="Jestem zakochany w tobie"
  translation="Je suis amoureux de toi"
  pronunciation="YEH-stehm zah-KOH-hah-nih f TOH-bee-eh"
  example="Jestem zakochany w tobie od pierwszego spojrzenia."
/>

| Polonais | FranÃ§ais | Prononciation | Moment d'utilisation |
|----------|----------|---------------|---------------------|
| **Kocham ciÄ™** | Je t'aime | KOH-hahm chyeh | Tous les jours, sans modÃ©ration |
| **Bardzo ciÄ™ kocham** | Je t'aime beaucoup | BAR-dzoh chyeh KOH-hahm | Pour renforcer votre amour |
| **Kocham ciÄ™ bardziej** | Je t'aime plus | KOH-hahm chyeh BAR-dzyay | RÃ©ponse tendre |
| **JesteÅ› mojÄ… miÅ‚oÅ›ciÄ…** | Tu es mon amour | YEH-stesh MOH-yahm MEE-wosh-chahm | DÃ©claration profonde |
| **TÄ™skniÄ™ za tobÄ…** | Tu me manques | TENSH-nyeh zah TOH-bah | En sÃ©paration |
| **MyÅ›lÄ™ o tobie** | Je pense Ã  toi | MIH-shleh oh TOH-bee-eh | Tout au long de la journÃ©e |
| **JesteÅ› piÄ™kna** | Tu es belle | YEH-stesh PYENG-knah | Pour complimenter |
| **JesteÅ› przystojny** | Tu es beau | YEH-stesh pshih-STOH-ih | Pour complimenter |
| **JesteÅ› wyjÄ…tkowa** | Tu es exceptionnelle | YEH-stesh vih-youn-TCOH-vah | Pour souligner l'unicitÃ© |
| **JesteÅ› moim Å›wiatem** | Tu es mon monde | YEH-stesh MOH-yeem SHVYAH-tehm | Amour total |

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡µğŸ‡±" title="Les Polonais et les dÃ©clarations">
Les Polonais sont souvent rÃ©servÃ©s avec leurs sentiments en public. Vos dÃ©clarations en polonais seront donc encore plus touchantes car elles montrent votre engagement Ã  comprendre leur culture.
</CultureTip>

## Phrases Pour Les Messages Doux et SMS

Envoyez ces petits mots d'amour par message pour illuminer la journÃ©e de votre partenaire.

- **Dobranoc, kochanie** (Bonne nuit, mon amour) - "doh-BRAH-nohts, koh-HAH-nyeh"
- **Åšpij dobrze** (Dors bien) - "shpeey DOHB-zheh"
- **Åšniadaniowa pocaÅ‚unek** (Baiser du petit-dÃ©jeuner) - "shnyah-dah-NYOH-vah poh-tsah-LOOH-nek"
- **MyÅ›lÄ™ o tobie non stop** (Je pense Ã  toi non stop) - "MIH-shleh oh TOH-bee-eh nohn stohp"

## Moments Romantiques : 10 Phrases Pour Les Rendez-vous

Parfaites pour vos soirÃ©es en tÃªte-Ã -tÃªte ou vos [rendez-vous galants](/learn/fr/pl/polish-date-night-vocabulary/).

| Polonais | FranÃ§ais | Prononciation |
|----------|----------|---------------|
| **WyglÄ…dasz cudownie** | Tu resplendis | vih-GLOUN-dahsh tsoo-DOH-vnyeh |
| **Masz piÄ™kne oczy** | Tu as de beaux yeux | mahsh PYENG-kneh OH-chih |
| **Podoba mi siÄ™ twÃ³j uÅ›miech** | J'aime ton sourire | poh-DAH-bah mee sheh TFOOY OOSH-myehkh |
| **Czuje siÄ™ szczÄ™Å›liwy z tobÄ…** | Je me sens heureux avec toi | CHOO-yeh shehsh SHCHEN-shlee-vih s TOH-bah |
| **JesteÅ› mojÄ… drugÄ… poÅ‚Ã³wkÄ…** | Tu es ma moitiÃ© | YEH-stesh MOH-yahm DROO-gah poh-WOOF-kahm |
| **ChcÄ™ spÄ™dziÄ‡ z tobÄ… caÅ‚e Å¼ycie** | Je veux passer ma vie avec toi | h-tseh SHPEN-dzeetch s TOH-bah TSAH-weh ZHIH-tseh |
| **Robisz mnie szczÄ™Å›liwym** | Tu me rends heureux | ROH-bee-shsh mn-yeh SHCHEN-shlee-vihm |
| **Nie potrafiÄ™ Å¼yÄ‡ bez ciebie** | Je ne peux pas vivre sans toi | nyeh poh-TRAH-fyeh zhihch behch CHYEH-byeh |
| **Zawsze bÄ™dÄ™ przy tobie** | Je serai toujours lÃ  pour toi | ZAHF-sheh BEN-deh pshih TOH-bee-eh |
| **JesteÅ› moim szczÄ™Å›ciem** | Tu es mon bonheur | YEH-stesh MOH-yeem SHCHEN-shchehm |

<VocabCard
  word="Czy zostaniesz mojÄ… drugÄ… poÅ‚Ã³wkÄ…?"
  translation="Veux-tu Ãªtre ma moitiÃ©?"
  pronunciation="chih zoh-STAH-nyesh MOH-yahm DROO-gah poh-WOOF-kahm?"
  example="To najwaÅ¼niejsze pytanie mojego Å¼ycia."
/>

## Phrases Pour Les Moments Difficiles

Quand votre relation traverse une pÃ©riode difficile, ces phrases peuvent aider Ã  raviver la flamme. Consultez aussi notre guide sur [comment argumenter constructivement en polonais](/learn/fr/pl/arguing-constructively-in-polish-communication-phrases-for-couples/).

- **Przepraszam, kochanie** (Pardon mon amour) - "psheh-PRAH-shahm, koh-HAH-nyeh"
- **Zrozumiem ciÄ™** (Je te comprends) - "ZROH-zoo-myeh chyeh"
- **Zawsze bÄ™dÄ™ ciÄ™ wspieraÄ‡** (Je te soutiendrai toujours) - "ZAHF-sheh BEN-deh chyeh FSHPEH-rahch"
- **DziÄ™kujÄ™ za cierpliwoÅ›Ä‡** (Merci pour ta patience) - "djen-KOO-yeh zah chyer-PLEE-vohshch"
- **JesteÅ› dla mnie najwaÅ¼niejszy** (Tu es le plus important pour moi) - "YEH-stesh dla mn-yeh nahy-vahsh-SHIH"

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡µğŸ‡±" title="L'importance des excuses">
En Pologne, les excuses sincÃ¨res sont trÃ¨s valorisÃ©es. Dire "przepraszam" avec authenticitÃ© peut apaiser bien des tensions dans un couple.
</CultureTip>

## Expressions Romantiques Quotidiennes

IntÃ©grez ces phrases dans votre routine quotidienne pour maintenir la romance.

| Polonais | FranÃ§ais | Prononciation |
|----------|----------|---------------|
| **MiÅ‚ego dnia, kochanie** | Bonne journÃ©e mon amour | MEE-weh-goh DNYAH, koh-HAH-nyeh |
| **UwaÅ¼aj na siebie** | Prends soin de toi | oo-VAH-zhay nah SHYEH-byeh |
| **Do zobaczenia** | Ã€ bientÃ´t | doh zoh-bah-CHEN-yah |
| **WrÃ³Ä‡ szybko** | Reviens vite | VROOCH SHIH-pkoh |
| **BÄ™dÄ™ tÄ™skniÅ‚** | Tu vas me manquer | BEN-deh TENSH-nyih |
| **Åšpij sÅ‚odko** | Fais de beaux rÃªves | shpeey SLOHD-koh |
| **MarzÄ™ o tobie** | Je rÃªve de toi | MAH-zhoh oh TOH-bee-eh |
| **JesteÅ› mojÄ… inspiracjÄ…** | Tu es mon inspiration | YEH-stesh MOH-yahm een-spee-rah-TSYOH |

<VocabCard
  word="Kocham ciÄ™ mimo wszystko"
  translation="Je t'aime malgrÃ© tout"
  pronunciation="KOH-hahm chyeh MEE-moh FSHST-koh"
  example="To prawdziwa miÅ‚oÅ›Ä‡ - kocham ciÄ™ mimo wszystko."
/>

## Phrases Pour Les Futures FianÃ§ailles

Quand vous Ãªtes prÃªt Ã  faire LE pas...

- **Czy wyjdziesz za mnie?** (Veux-tu m'Ã©pouser?) - "chih VIH-dzyesh zah mn-yeh?"
- **Zostaniesz mojÄ… Å¼onÄ…?** (Veux-tu devenir ma femme?) - "zoh-STAH-nyesh MOH-yahm ZHOH-nahm?"
- **PoÅ›lubisz mnie?** (Veux-tu me marier?) - "POH-shloo-beesh mn-yeh?"
- **ChcÄ™ siÄ™ z tobÄ… zestarzeÄ‡** (Je veux vieillir avec toi) - "h-tseh sheh s TOH-bah zeh-STAR-zhehch"
- **BÄ™dÄ™ ciÄ™ kochaÄ‡ aÅ¼ po kres moich dni** (Je t'aimerai jusqu'Ã  la fin de mes jours) - "BEN-deh chyeh KOH-hahch ahsh poh krehs MOH-yih dnee"

## Comment Utiliser Ces Phrases Avec SuccÃ¨s

### Astuces pour des dÃ©clarations authentiques :

1. **Pratiquez la prononciation ensemble** - Riez de vos erreurs, c'est Ã§a l'amour !
2. **Commencez par les plus simples** - "Kocham ciÄ™" suffit pour commencer
3. **CrÃ©ez des moments spÃ©ciaux** - Un dÃ®ner, une balade, un SMS inattendu
4. **Soyez cohÃ©rent** - Utilisez-les rÃ©guliÃ¨rement, pas seulement les jours de fÃªte
5. **Ajoutez vos propres mots** - Personnalisez ces phrases avec vos souvenirs partagÃ©s

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡µğŸ‡±" title="Le timing en Pologne">
Les Polonais apprÃ©cient particuliÃ¨rement les dÃ©clarations spontanÃ©es. Pas besoin d'occasion spÃ©ciale - un "kocham ciÄ™" au supermarchÃ© peut Ãªtre plus touchant qu'un discours romantique prÃ©parÃ©.
</CultureTip>

Ces 50 phrases romantiques polonaises transformeront votre relation en ajoutant cette touche magique qui vient seulement des mots appris dans la langue de votre aimÃ©. Chaque "kocham ciÄ›" prononcÃ© avec votre accent franÃ§ais deviendra un souvenir prÃ©cieux pour vous deux.

<CTA />

sections: ## Comment Utiliser Ces Phrases Avec SuccÃ¨s

articles.title: At mÃ¸de din italienske partners familie: VÃ¦sentlige fraser og kulturelle tips
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Du stÃ¥r foran dÃ¸ren til din italienske partners barndomshjem. Din mave summer som en Vespa-scooter i Rom, og du kan mÃ¦rke nerverne snige sig ind. Men forestil dig i stedet at trÃ¦de ind med selvtillid, klar til at hilse pÃ¥ svigerfamilien pÃ¥ deres eget sprog med et varmt "Buongiorno!" og en charmerende kommentar om mormors hjemmelavede tiramisu. Denne guide gÃ¸r dig klar til at skabe en uforglemmelig fÃ¸rste forbindelse med din elskedes familie - og mÃ¥ske endda vinde deres hjerter fÃ¸r du ved af det.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Ãˆ un piacere conoscerla"
  translation="Det er en fornÃ¸jelse at mÃ¸de Dem"
  pronunciation="eh oon pee-ah-CHEH-reh koh-noh-SHEHR-lah"
  context="Den perfekte formelle hilsen til forÃ¦ldre og bedsteforÃ¦ldre"
/>

## FÃ¸r du trÃ¦der ind ad dÃ¸ren: Forberedelse er nÃ¸glen

Din italienske partner har sandsynligvis fortalt dig, at familien betyder alt - og det er ikke overdrevet. Italienske familier er tÃ¦tte, kÃ¦rlige og kan virke overvÃ¦ldende i starten. Men med de rigtige fraser og forstÃ¥else for kulturen, vil du fÃ¸le dig hjemme pÃ¥ ingen tid.

<VocabCard
  word="Porta un regalo"
  translation="Medbring en gave"
  pronunciation="POHR-tah oon reh-GAH-loh"
  example="Porto un regalo per la mamma."
/>

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹" title="Gaveetikette i Italien">
Italienske forÃ¦ldre sÃ¦tter pris pÃ¥ gennemtÃ¦nkte gaver snarere end dyre. En flaske god olivenolie, specialkaffe eller noget typisk fra dit hjemland viser respekt og tankefuldhed. Husk at pakke det pÃ¦nt ind!
</CultureTip>

## Vigtige hilsener og hÃ¸flighedsfraser

| Italiensk | Udtale | Dansk | Situation |
|-----------|---------|--------|-----------|
| **Buongiorno** | bwohn-DJOR-noh | Goddag | Formel hilsen (brug til fÃ¸rste mÃ¸de) |
| **Buonasera** | bwoh-nah-SEH-rah | Godaften | Efter kl. 16 |
| **Come sta?** | KOH-meh stah | Hvordan har De det? | Formelt spÃ¸rgsmÃ¥l til forÃ¦ldre |
| **Come stai?** | KOH-meh stah-ee | Hvordan har du det? | Uformelt til sÃ¸skende |
| **Molto piacere** | MOHL-toh pee-ah-CHEH-reh | Meget fornÃ¸jelse | NÃ¥r I prÃ¦senteres |
| **Grazie mille** | GRAH-tsee-eh MEEL-leh | Tusind tak | Vis taknemmelighed |
| **Per favore** | pehr fah-VOH-reh | Venligst | VÃ¦r hÃ¸flig |
| **Scusi** | SCOO-zee | Undskyld | Hvis du kommer til at banke ind i noget |

## Specifikke scenarier med svigerfamilien

### 1. FÃ¸rste mÃ¸de ved dÃ¸ren

**Din partner**: "Mamma, questo Ã¨ [dit navn]!"
**Dig**: "Buongiorno signora! Ãˆ un piacere conoscerla. (eh oon pee-ah-CHEH-reh koh-noh-SHEHR-lah)"
**Mormor**: "Ma che carino! Entra, entra!" (Ã…h, hvor sÃ¸d! Kom ind!)

<VocabCard
  word="Che carino/a"
  translation="Hvor sÃ¸d/t"
  pronunciation="keh kah-REE-noh/nah"
  example="Che carina questa casa!"
/>

### 2. Komplimenter til maden (SUPERVIGTIGT!)

Italienske mÃ¸dre lever for at hÃ¸re komplimenter om deres mad. Dette er din chance for at vinde hendes hjerte:

- **"Che buona questa pasta!"** (keh BWOH-nah KWEH-stah PAH-stah) - "Hvor er denne pasta lÃ¦kker!"
- **"Mamma mia, che sapore!"** (MAHM-mah MEE-ah, keh sah-POH-reh) - "Hvor smagfuldt!"
- **"Complimenti alla cuoca!"** (kohm-plee-MEHN-tee AHL-lah KWOH-kah) - "Komplimenter til kokken!"

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹" title="Spisekultur">
Spis ALT hvad der bliver serveret, og tag gerne flere portioner. Det er den stÃ¸rste kompliment du kan give! Hvis du er mÃ¦t, sig "Sono pieno/a, ma Ã¨ troppo buono!" (Jeg er mÃ¦t, men det er for lÃ¦kkert!)
</CultureTip>

### 3. Samtaler om familien

Vis interesse for familien ved at spÃ¸rge:

- **"Come si conoscono i genitori?"** (KOH-meh see koh-noh-SKOH-noh ee jeh-nee-TOH-ree) - "Hvordan mÃ¸dtes forÃ¦ldrene?"
- **"Da quanto tempo state insieme?"** (dah KWAHN-toh TEHM-poh STAH-teh een-SYEH-meh) - "Hvor lÃ¦nge har I vÃ¦ret sammen?" (til sÃ¸skende)
- **"Che lavoro fa?"** (keh lah-VOH-roh fah) - "Hvad arbejder De med?"

## Udvidet ordforrÃ¥d til familiesammenkomster

### Familiemedlemmer
| Italiensk | Udtale | Dansk |
|-----------|---------|--------|
| **I genitori** | ee jeh-nee-TOH-ree | ForÃ¦ldrene |
| **I nonni** | ee NOHN-nee | BedsteforÃ¦ldrene |
| **Il fratello** | eel frah-TEHL-loh | Broderen |
| **La sorella** | lah soh-REHL-lah | SÃ¸steren |
| **Il cognato** | eel koh-NYAH-toh | Svogeren |
| **La cognata** | lah koh-NYAH-tah | Svigerinden |
| **Lo zio** | loh TSEE-oh | Onklen |
| **La zia** | lah TSEE-ah | Tantern |

### Beskrivende ord
- **Gentile** (jehn-TEE-leh) - Venlig
- **Accogliente** (ahk-koh-LYEHN-teh) - ImÃ¸dekommende
- **Simpatico/a** (seem-PAH-tee-koh/kah) - Sympatisk
- **Bravo/a** (BRAH-voh/vah) - Dygtig/flink

## HÃ¸flighed og formalitet

Italiensk kultur vÃ¦gter respekt for Ã¦ldre hÃ¸jt. Brug disse former:

**Til forÃ¦ldre og bedsteforÃ¦ldre (formelt):**
- Brug **"Lei"** (De) formen
- Sig **"Signore/Signora"** fÃ¸rste gang
- Vent pÃ¥ at de inviterer dig til at bruge **"tu"**

**Til sÃ¸skende og jÃ¦vnaldrende (uformelt):**
- Brug **"tu"** med det samme
- VÃ¦r varm og Ã¥ben
- Brug hÃ¥ndbevÃ¦gelser - det er helt naturligt!

<VocabCard
  word="Posso darti del tu?"
  translation="MÃ¥ jeg sige du til dig?"
  pronunciation="POHS-soh DAHR-tee dehl too"
  example="Posso darti del tu, Maria?"
/>

## NÃ¥r tingene gÃ¥r skÃ¦vt...

Ingen panik! Her er redningsfraserne:

- **"Non capisco"** (nohn kah-PEE-skoh) - "Jeg forstÃ¥r ikke"
- **"PuÃ² ripetere, per favore?"** (pwoh ree-peh-TEH-reh pehr fah-VOH-reh) - "Kan De gentage, venligst?"
- **"Mi dispiace, sto imparando l'italiano"** (mee dees-SPYAH-cheh stoh eem-PAH-rahn-doh lee-tah-LYAH-noh) - "Undskyld, jeg lÃ¦rer italiensk"
- **"PuÃ² aiutarmi?"** (pwoh ah-yoo-TAHR-mee) - "Kan De hjÃ¦lpe mig?"

Hvis du vil imponere med [romantiske italienske fraser](/learn/da/it/romantic-italian-phrases-for-every-occasion/), sÃ¥ vis din partner at du ogsÃ¥ har Ã¸vet de blÃ¸de ord!

## Pro tips fra italienske partnere

1. **Bring en lille gave til huset** - mÃ¥ske blomster til mamma
2. **Komplimenter kÃ¸kkenet** - altid og ofte!
3. **Spis med appetit** - det viser respekt
4. **LÃ¦r et par historier om din egen familie** - de elsker familiefortÃ¦llinger
5. **VÃ¦r forberedt pÃ¥ spÃ¸rgsmÃ¥l om bÃ¸rn og fremtiden** - italienske forÃ¦ldre er nysgerrige
6. **Vis interesse for italiensk kultur** - spÃ¸rg om traditioner
7. **Tag billeder sammen** - det viser du vil huske dagen

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹" title="Italiensk familiesjÃ¦l">
Italienske familier er som en varm kamin - de omfavner dig med det samme, men respekterer deres traditioner, og du vil altid have en plads ved bordet. Vis oprigtig interesse, og du har venner for livet!
</CultureTip>

## Hurtig referencekort - Tag et screenshot!

1. **Buongiorno signora/signore!** (bwohn-DJOR-noh see-NYOH-rah/SYOH-reh)
2. **Ãˆ un piacere conoscerla** (eh oon pee-ah-CHEH-reh koh-noh-SHEHR-lah)
3. **Che bella casa!** (keh BEHL-lah KAH-zah) - "Hvor fint et hjem!"
4. **Grazie mille per l'invito** (GRAH-tsee-eh MEEL-leh pehr leen-VEE-toh)
5. **Posso aiutare in cucina?** (POHS-soh ah-yoo-TAH-reh een koo-CHEE-nah)
6. **Ãˆ delizioso!** (eh deh-lee-tsee-OH-zoh)
7. **Come si chiama questo piatto?** (KOH-meh see KYAH-mah KWEH-stoh PYAHT-toh)
8. **Sono pieno/a, ma Ã¨ troppo buono!** (SOH-noh pee-EH-noh/nah mah eh TROHP-poh BWOH-noh)
9. **Posso avere la ricetta?** (POHS-soh ah-VEH-reh lah ree-CHEHT-tah)
10. **Grazie di tutto, Ã¨ stata una bellissima giornata** (GRAH-tsee-eh dee TOOT-toh eh STAH-tah OO-nah behl-LEE-see-mah johr-NAH-tah)

Med disse fraser i baglommen er du klar til at mÃ¸de din italienske partners familie med selvtillid og charme. Husk: de vil elske dig, fordi du elsker deres barn. Alt andet er bare bonus!

For at Ã¸ve endnu mere, tjek vores guide til [vigtige italienske fraser for par](/learn/da/it/essential-italian-phrases-for-couples/) - sÃ¥ kan I Ã¸ve sammen fÃ¸r det store mÃ¸de.

<CTA />

articles.title: Wymowa rosyjska i cyrylica - przewodnik dla PolakÃ³w
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Rosyjski uÅ¼ywa cyrylicy - ale dla PolakÃ³w nie jest to tak trudne! Wiele liter wyglÄ…da podobnie, a wymowa ma elementy wspÃ³lne z polskim.

## Alfabet cyrylicy

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Ğ ÑƒÑÑĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ Ğ°Ğ»Ñ„Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‚"
  translation="Rosyjski alfabet"
  pronunciation="ru-skij aÅ‚-fa-wit"
  context="33 litery do nauki!"
/>

### Litery podobne do Å‚acinki

| Cyrylica | DÅºwiÄ™k | Jak w polskim |
|----------|--------|---------------|
| **Ğ Ğ°** | a | jak "a" |
| **Ğ• Ğµ** | je | jak "je" |
| **Ğš Ğº** | k | jak "k" |
| **Ğœ Ğ¼** | m | jak "m" |
| **Ğ Ğ¾** | o | jak "o" |
| **Ğ¢ Ñ‚** | t | jak "t" |

### Litery wyglÄ…dajÄ…ce jak Å‚aciÅ„skie, ale inne!

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ’Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğµ! ĞŸÑƒĞ»Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ñ‹!"
  translation="Uwaga! FaÅ‚szywi przyjaciele!"
  pronunciation="wni-ma-ni-je! pu-Å‚o-wie-ry!"
  example="Te litery WYGLÄ„DAJÄ„ znajomo, ale brzmiÄ… INACZEJ!"
/>

| Cyrylica | WyglÄ…da jak | Ale brzmi jak |
|----------|-------------|---------------|
| **Ğ’ Ğ²** | B | w |
| **Ğ Ğ½** | H | n |
| **Ğ  Ñ€** | P | r |
| **Ğ¡ Ñ** | C | s |
| **Ğ£ Ñƒ** | Y | u |
| **Ğ¥ Ñ…** | X | ch |

<CultureTip title="NajczÄ™stszy bÅ‚Ä…d!" flag="ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡º">
ĞĞµ "nie" wyglÄ…da jak "He", ale brzmi jak "nie"! "Ğ Ğ¾ÑÑĞ¸Ñ" wyglÄ…da jak "Poccnr", ale to "Rasija" (Rosja). UwaÅ¼aj na faÅ‚szywych przyjaciÃ³Å‚!
</CultureTip>

### Nowe litery

| Cyrylica | DÅºwiÄ™k | PrzykÅ‚ad |
|----------|--------|----------|
| **Ğ‘ Ğ±** | b | Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ (brat) |
| **Ğ“ Ğ³** | g | Ğ³Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´ (gorad) |
| **Ğ” Ğ´** | d | Ğ´Ğ° (da) |
| **Ğ– Ğ¶** | Å¼ | Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ° (Å¼ena) |
| **Ğ— Ğ·** | z | Ğ·Ğ²ĞµĞ·Ğ´Ğ° (zwiezda) |
| **Ğ˜ Ğ¸** | i | Ğ¸Ğ¼Ñ (imia) |
| **Ğ™ Ğ¹** | j (krÃ³tkie) | Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¹ (moj) |
| **Ğ› Ğ»** | l | Ğ»ÑĞ±Ğ¾Ğ²ÑŒ (liubof') |
| **ĞŸ Ğ¿** | p | Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ²ĞµÑ‚ (priwiet) |
| **Ğ¤ Ñ„** | f | Ñ„Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾ (foto) |
| **Ğ¦ Ñ†** | c | Ñ†Ğ°Ñ€ÑŒ (car') |
| **Ğ§ Ñ‡** | cz | Ñ‡Ğ°Ñ (czas) |
| **Ğ¨ Ñˆ** | sz | ÑˆĞºĞ¾Ğ»Ğ° (szkoÅ‚a) |
| **Ğ© Ñ‰** | szcz | ĞµÑ‰Ñ‘ (jeszczo) |

### Specjalne litery

| Cyrylica | DÅºwiÄ™k | Uwagi |
|----------|--------|-------|
| **Ğ« Ñ‹** | y (twarde) | miÄ™dzy "y" a "i" |
| **Ğ­ Ñ** | e | jak polskie "e" |
| **Ğ® Ñ** | ju | jak "ju" |
| **Ğ¯ Ñ** | ja | jak "ja" |
| **Ğ Ñ‘** | jo | jak "jo" (zawsze akcentowane) |
| **Ğ¬** | znak miÄ™kki | miÄ™kczy poprzedniÄ… spÃ³Å‚gÅ‚oskÄ™ |
| **Ğª** | znak twardy | oddziela (rzadki) |

## Redukcja samogÅ‚osek

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Ğ¥Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞ¾ = Ğ¥Ğ°Ñ€Ğ°ÑˆĞ¾"
  translation="Dobrze"
  pronunciation="ha-ra-szo (NIE ho-ro-szo!)"
  context="O bez akcentu brzmi jak A!"
/>

### Zasada akcentu

W rosyjskim **tylko akcentowana samogÅ‚oska** brzmi czysto. Reszta jest "redukowana":

| Litera | Pod akcentem | Bez akcentu |
|--------|--------------|-------------|
| **Ğ** | o | a (lub É™) |
| **Ğ** | a | a (lub É™) |
| **Ğ•** | je | i |
| **Ğ¯** | ja | i |

<VocabCard
  word="ĞœĞ¾Ğ»Ğ¾ĞºĞ¾ = ĞœĞ°Å‚ako"
  translation="Mleko"
  pronunciation="ma-Å‚a-KO"
  example="Akcent na ostatniej sylabie - pierwsze O brzmi jak A!"
/>

### PrzykÅ‚ady redukcji

| Pisownia | Wymowa | Akcent na |
|----------|--------|-----------|
| **Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞ¾** | ha-ra-SZO | 3. sylabie |
| **Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾ĞºĞ¾** | ma-Å‚a-KO | 3. sylabie |
| **ĞœĞ¾ÑĞºĞ²Ğ°** | ma-SKWA | 2. sylabie |
| **ÑĞ¿Ğ°ÑĞ¸Ğ±Ğ¾** | spa-SI-ba | 2. sylabie |

<CultureTip title="Akcent zmienia znaczenie!" flag="ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡º">
Ğ’ rosyjskim akcent jest ruchomy i moÅ¼e zmieniaÄ‡ znaczenie! "Ğ—Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğº" (ZA-mak = zamek/paÅ‚ac) vs "Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğº" (za-MOK = zamek/kÅ‚Ã³dka). Uczcie siÄ™ sÅ‚Ã³w z akcentem!
</CultureTip>

## MiÄ™kkoÅ›Ä‡ spÃ³Å‚gÅ‚osek

### Znak miÄ™kki Ğ¬

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ›ÑĞ±Ğ¾Ğ²ÑŒ"
  translation="MiÅ‚oÅ›Ä‡"
  pronunciation="liu-BOF'"
  example="Ğ¬ miÄ™kczy koÅ„cowe Ğ’"
/>

| Z Ğ¬ | Bez Ğ¬ | RÃ³Å¼nica |
|-----|-------|---------|
| **Ğ¼Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ** (mat') | **Ğ¼Ğ°Ñ‚** (mat) | matka vs mata |
| **Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ** (brat') | **Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚** (brat) | braÄ‡ vs brat |

### MiÄ™kkie przed Ğ•, Ğ, Ğ˜, Ğ®, Ğ¯

SpÃ³Å‚gÅ‚oski przed tymi samogÅ‚oskami sÄ… miÄ™kkie:

| Twarde | MiÄ™kkie |
|--------|---------|
| **Ñ‚Ğ°** (ta) | **Ñ‚Ñ** (tia) |
| **Ğ½Ñƒ** (nu) | **Ğ½Ñ** (niu) |
| **Ğ»Ğ¾** (Å‚o) | **Ğ»Ñ‘** (lio) |

## DÅºwiÄ™ki trudne dla PolakÃ³w

### Ğ« - twarde "y"

<VocabCard
  word="Ğ¢Ñ‹, Ğ¼Ñ‹, Ğ²Ñ‹"
  translation="Ty, my, wy"
  pronunciation="ty, my, wy (twarde!)"
  example="Ğ« to dÅºwiÄ™k miÄ™dzy polskim 'y' a 'i'"
/>

**Jak wymÃ³wiÄ‡ Ğ«:**
1. Powiedz "i"
2. Cofnij jÄ™zyk do tyÅ‚u
3. DÅºwiÄ™k jest bardziej "gardÅ‚owy"

### Ğ¨ vs Ğ©

| Litera | DÅºwiÄ™k | Jak Ä‡wiczyÄ‡ |
|--------|--------|-------------|
| **Ğ¨** | sz (twarde) | jak polskie "sz" |
| **Ğ©** | szcz (miÄ™kkie) | jak polskie "szcz" ale dÅ‚uÅ¼sze |

### Ğ– - twarde "Å¼"

Rosyjskie Ğ– jest twarde - jak polskie "Å¼" ale bez miÄ™kkoÅ›ci:
- Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ° (Å¼ena) - Å¼ona
- Ğ¶Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ½ÑŒ (Å¼yzÅ„) - Å¼ycie

## Ä†wiczenia

### Ä†wiczenie 1: Alfabet
Przeczytajcie:
- Ğ Ğ‘ Ğ’ Ğ“ Ğ” Ğ• Ğ Ğ– Ğ—
- Ğ˜ Ğ™ Ğš Ğ› Ğœ Ğ Ğ ĞŸ Ğ 
- Ğ¡ Ğ¢ Ğ£ Ğ¤ Ğ¥ Ğ¦ Ğ§ Ğ¨ Ğ©
- Ğª Ğ« Ğ¬ Ğ­ Ğ® Ğ¯

### Ä†wiczenie 2: Redukcja O
WymÃ³wcie poprawnie:
- ĞœĞ¾ÑĞºĞ²Ğ° (ma-SKWA)
- Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞ¾ (ha-ra-SZO)
- Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾ĞºĞ¾ (ma-Å‚a-KO)

### Ä†wiczenie 3: Romantyczne sÅ‚owa

| SÅ‚owo | Wymowa |
|-------|--------|
| **Ğ¯ Ñ‚ĞµĞ±Ñ Ğ»ÑĞ±Ğ»Ñ** | ja ti-BIA liu-BLIU |
| **Ğ»ÑĞ±Ğ¸Ğ¼Ñ‹Ğ¹** | liu-BI-myj |
| **ÑĞ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ñ‹ÑˆĞºĞ¾** | SOÅ-nysz-ka |
| **ÑĞµÑ€Ğ´Ñ†Ğµ** | SIER-ce |

## Podsumowanie

Cyrylica wyglÄ…da obco, ale jest logiczna! Kluczowe elementy:
- UwaÅ¼aj na "faÅ‚szywych przyjaciÃ³Å‚" (Ğ’=w, Ğ=n, Ğ =r, Ğ¡=s)
- Redukcja samogÅ‚osek - O bez akcentu = A
- Znak miÄ™kki Ğ¬ - miÄ™kczy poprzedniÄ… literÄ™
- Ğ« - twarde "y" miÄ™dzy "y" a "i"

## Kontynuuj naukÄ™

- **[Podstawy gramatyki](/learn/pl/ru/russian-grammar-basics/)** - Fundament jÄ™zyka
- **[NiezbÄ™dne zwroty](/learn/pl/ru/russian-essential-phrases-for-couples/)** - Praktyczne wyraÅ¼enia
- **[Powitania i poÅ¼egnania](/learn/pl/ru/russian-greetings-farewells/)** - Podstawowe zwroty
- **[Jak powiedzieÄ‡ "kocham ciÄ™"](/learn/pl/ru/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-russian/)** - Romantyczne wyznania

<CTA text="Gotowi mÃ³wiÄ‡ po rosyjsku?" buttonText="Zacznij teraz" />

articles.title: Spotkanie z turecka rodzina partnera - przewodnik jÄ™zykowy
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Spotkanie z turecka rodzina partnera to waÅ¼ny krok. Turecka rodzina jest bardzo zjednoczona, a goscinnosc to podstawa kultury. Ten przewodnik przygotuje cie na to waÅ¼ne spotkanie!

## Nazwy czlonkow rodziny

<VocabCard
  word="aile"
  translation="rodzina"
  pronunciation="a-i-le"
  example="Ailenizi tanÄ±maktan mutluluk duyuyorum."
/>

### Rodzice partnera

| Turecki | Wymowa | Polski |
|---------|--------|--------|
| **anne** | an-ne | mama |
| **baba** | ba-ba | tata |
| **kayÄ±nvalide** | ka-jin-wa-li-de | tesciowa |
| **kayÄ±npeder** | ka-jin-pe-der | tesc |
| **anne ve baba** | an-ne we ba-ba | rodzice |

<CultureTip title="Formy zwracania sie" flag="ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡·">
Na poczatku zwracaj siÄ™ do rodzicow partnera per "siz" (Pan/Pani) i uzywaj tytulow jak "Teyze" (ciocia, dla matki partnera) lub "Amca" (wujek, dla ojca partnera) - to wyraz szacunku!
</CultureTip>

### Rodzenstwo i krewni

| Turecki | Wymowa | Polski |
|---------|--------|--------|
| **kardeÅŸ** | kar-desz | rodzenstwo |
| **aÄŸabey** | a-a-bej | starszy brat |
| **abla** | ab-la | starsza siostra |
| **erkek kardeÅŸ** | er-kek kar-desz | (mlodszy) brat |
| **kÄ±z kardeÅŸ** | kiz kar-desz | (mlodsza) siostra |
| **bÃ¼yÃ¼kanne** | bu-juk-an-ne | babcia |
| **bÃ¼yÃ¼kbaba** | bu-juk-ba-ba | dziadek |

### Dalsza rodzina

| Turecki | Wymowa | Polski |
|---------|--------|--------|
| **teyze** | tej-ze | ciotka (od strony matki) |
| **hala** | ha-la | ciotka (od strony ojca) |
| **dayÄ±** | da-ji | wujek (od strony matki) |
| **amca** | am-dza | wujek (od strony ojca) |
| **kuzen** | ku-zen | kuzyn/kuzynka |

## Pierwsze spotkanie

<PhraseOfDay
  word="TanÄ±ÅŸtÄ±ÄŸÄ±mÄ±za memnun oldum"
  translation="Milo mi Panstwa poznac"
  pronunciation="ta-nisz-ti-i-mi-za mem-nun ol-dum"
  context="Formalne powitanie przy pierwszym spotkaniu"
/>

### Powitania

| Turecki | Wymowa | Polski |
|---------|--------|--------|
| **Merhaba!** | mer-ha-ba | DzieÅ„ dobry! |
| **TanÄ±ÅŸtÄ±ÄŸÄ±mÄ±za memnun oldum** | ta-nisz-ti-i-mi-za mem-nun ol-dum | Milo mi poznac |
| **Sizinle ilgili Ã§ok ÅŸey duydum** | si-zin-le il-gi-li czok szej duj-dum | DuÅ¼o o Panstwu slyszalem |
| **Size kÃ¼Ã§Ã¼k bir hediye getirdim** | si-ze ku-czuk bir he-di-je ge-tir-dim | Przynioslem maly prezent |

<CultureTip title="Prezenty dla rodziny" flag="ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡·">
W Turcji wypada przyjsc z prezentem - slodycze (lokum, baklawa), kwiaty lub cos z Polski. Turcy bardzo doceniaja gosc, ktory przynosi dary! Unikaj alkoholu, jeÅ›li rodzina jest religijna.
</CultureTip>

## Uprzejme zwroty

<VocabCard
  word="Ã‡ok naziksiniz"
  translation="Sa Panstwo bardzo uprzejmi"
  pronunciation="czok na-zik-si-niz"
  example="Ã‡ok naziksiniz, davet iÃ§in teÅŸekkÃ¼r ederim."
/>

| Turecki | Wymowa | Polski |
|---------|--------|--------|
| **TeÅŸekkÃ¼r ederim** | te-szek-kur e-de-rim | Dziekuje |
| **Ã‡ok teÅŸekkÃ¼r ederim** | czok te-szek-kur e-de-rim | Dziekuje bardzo |
| **LÃ¼tfen** | lut-fen | Prosze |
| **Affedersiniz** | af-fe-der-si-niz | Przepraszam |
| **Ã–zÃ¼r dilerim** | o-zur di-le-rim | Przepraszam (za bled) |

## Przy stole

<VocabCard
  word="Ã‡ok lezzetli!"
  translation="Bardzo pyszne!"
  pronunciation="czok lez-zet-li"
  example="Anne, yemek Ã§ok lezzetli!"
/>

### Podstawowe zwroty

| Turecki | Wymowa | Polski |
|---------|--------|--------|
| **Afiyet olsun!** | a-fi-jet ol-sun | Smacznego! |
| **Åerefe!** | sze-re-fe | Na zdrowie! (toast) |
| **TeÅŸekkÃ¼rler, yeter** | te-szek-kur-ler, je-ter | Dziekuje, wystarczy |
| **Biraz daha alabilir miyim?** | bi-raz da-ha a-la-bi-lir mi-jim | Moge wziac jeszcze troche? |
| **Yemek Ã§ok gÃ¼zel** | je-mek czok gu-zel | Jedzenie jest bardzo pyszne |

<CultureTip title="Turecka goscinnosc" flag="ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡·">
Turcy sÄ… slynni z goscinnosci! Beda nalegac, Å¼ebys jadl wiÄ™cej - to "misafirperverlik" (goscinnosc). Przygotuj siÄ™ na obfite posilki, czesta herbate i kawe. Odmowa moze byc odebrana jako niegreczna!
</CultureTip>

## Rozmowa z rodzina

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Aileniz nereli?"
  translation="Skad pochodzi Panstwa rodzina?"
  pronunciation="a-i-le-niz ne-re-li"
  context="Dobre pytanie na poczatek rozmowy"
/>

### Pytania i odpowiedzi

| Turecki | Wymowa | Polski |
|---------|--------|--------|
| **Nerede Ã§alÄ±ÅŸÄ±yorsunuz?** | ne-re-de cza-li-szi-jor-su-nuz | Gdzie Panstwo pracuja? |
| **Polonya'dan geliyorum** | po-lon-ja-dan ge-li-jo-rum | Jestem z Polski |
| **Evet, onu Ã§ok seviyorum** | e-wet, o-nu czok se-wi-jo-rum | Tak, bardzo go/ja kocham |

## Wskazowki kulturowe

### Co robic:
- Zdjac buty przy wejsciu
- Przyniesc prezent
- Komplementowac jedzenie i dom
- Uzywac formalnych zwrotow
- Okazywac szacunek starszym
- Przyjac herbate i jedzenie

### Czego unikac:
- Odmawiac jedzenia lub herbaty
- Przychodzic z pustymi rekami
- Uzywac "sen" (ty) do starszych
- Krytykowac czegokolwiek
- Pokazywac podeszwy stop (niegreczne!)

## Podsumowanie

Spotkanie z turecka rodzina partnera to szansa na doswiadczenie slynnej tureckiej goscinnosci. Turcy sÄ… ciepli i wylewni - nawet podstawowa znajomosc jÄ™zyka zrobi ogromne wrazenie!
